intro: Pamphilia vilcabambae, commonly known as the Vilcabamba datura, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshade plants, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Its leaves are broad and ovate, while its flowers range in color from white to purple, often opening at night. Due to its habitat and appearance, it is sometimes referred to as the "moonflower" in local communities.
